We Rock Hackathons In Chicago!

MonkeyBars

Attending?

Hosting?

Why

The Methods to Our Madness

The playground is a place to have fun, make mistakes and meet friends. That is what we want our events to embody. Outside of that…it just sounded good at the time.

What

You Got Questions. We Got Answers.

The overnighter is a productivity legend. With a looming deadline and weeks of procrastination behind you, something needs to be finished by tomorrow. You summon the strength of Gods to pull it off in a matter of hours. Bottle that miracle and put it in the context of a challenge posed by a company or a project you've always wanted to work on. That's a hackathon.

How

The Fun of it All

Hackathons are a lot like cake, and hackathon cake has three main ingredients: learning, collaborating, and building. MonkeyBars believes in the process of falling and getting back up with every space we create, in the power of diverse, supportive teamwork when embarking on any worthwhile journey, and provides the people, the place, the tools, and the grub.

Our Events

IOTWF Hackathon

Imagine a world where inanimate objects have the chance to speak. That world is the Internet of Things (IoT).

MonkeyBars Open Build

Work on whatever you feel like! Technical or non technical, from scratch or a current product. Whatever.

Mar 29-30IIT

Re-Imagination Challenge

Hey IIT Students, put the money where your mouth is and create some innovative ideas to change the face of IIT.

The Team

Taylor Harvey

Social Engineer

Howdy! I’m one of the original Monkeys on the team and my vision from the beginning has been to discover how hackathons could improve the way people learn new skills and discover their passions.

Emmanuel Marcha

Developer & Designer

Hi there! I’m Manny and I really hate writing personal bios. There’s nothing more annoying than having to list my accomplishments in a superfluous (yet subtle) way.

Rani Shah

Strategy Engineer

You could say MonkeyBars found me. I’m always looking to work with and meet people who not only encourage ‘thinking outside the box’ but completely ‘redesigning the shape of the box’.
